50 // Structure LastFrameCollisionInfo
55 struct LastFrameCollisionInfo {
56 
57  // TODO OPTI : Use bit flags instead of bools here
58 
60  bool isValid;
61 
63  bool isObsolete;
64 
66  bool wasColliding;
67 
69  bool wasUsingGJK;
70 
72  bool wasUsingSAT;
73 
74  // ----- GJK Algorithm -----
75 
77  Vector3 gjkSeparatingAxis;
78 
79  // SAT Algorithm
80  bool satIsAxisFacePolyhedron1;
81  bool satIsAxisFacePolyhedron2;
82  uint8 satMinAxisFaceIndex;
83  uint8 satMinEdge1Index;
84  uint8 satMinEdge2Index;
85 
87  LastFrameCollisionInfo()
88  :isValid(false), isObsolete(false), wasColliding(false), wasUsingGJK(false), gjkSeparatingAxis(Vector3(0, 1, 0)),
89  satIsAxisFacePolyhedron1(false), satIsAxisFacePolyhedron2(false), satMinAxisFaceIndex(0),
90  satMinEdge1Index(0), satMinEdge2Index(0) {
91 
92  }
93 };
94 
95 // Class OverlappingPairs
103 class OverlappingPairs {
104 
105  public:
106 
107  struct OverlappingPair {
108 
110  uint64 pairID;
111 
113  // TODO OPTI : Is this used ?
114  int32 broadPhaseId1;
115 
117  // TODO OPTI : Is this used ?
118  int32 broadPhaseId2;
119 
121  Entity collider1;
122 
124  Entity collider2;
125 
127  bool needToTestOverlap;
128 
130  NarrowPhaseAlgorithmType narrowPhaseAlgorithmType;
131 
133  bool collidingInPreviousFrame;
134 
136  bool collidingInCurrentFrame;
137 
139  OverlappingPair(uint64 pairId, int32 broadPhaseId1, int32 broadPhaseId2, Entity collider1, Entity collider2,
140  NarrowPhaseAlgorithmType narrowPhaseAlgorithmType)
141  : pairID(pairId), broadPhaseId1(broadPhaseId1), broadPhaseId2(broadPhaseId2), collider1(collider1) , collider2(collider2),
142  needToTestOverlap(false), narrowPhaseAlgorithmType(narrowPhaseAlgorithmType), collidingInPreviousFrame(false),
143  collidingInCurrentFrame(false) {
144 
145  }
146 
148  virtual ~OverlappingPair() = default;
149  };
150 
151  // Overlapping pair between two convex colliders
152  struct ConvexOverlappingPair : public OverlappingPair {
153 
158  LastFrameCollisionInfo lastFrameCollisionInfo;
159 
161  ConvexOverlappingPair(uint64 pairId, int32 broadPhaseId1, int32 broadPhaseId2, Entity collider1, Entity collider2,
162  NarrowPhaseAlgorithmType narrowPhaseAlgorithmType)
163  : OverlappingPair(pairId, broadPhaseId1, broadPhaseId2, collider1, collider2, narrowPhaseAlgorithmType) {
164 
165  }
166  };
167 
168  // Overlapping pair between two a convex collider and a concave collider
169  struct ConcaveOverlappingPair : public OverlappingPair {
170 
171  private:
172 
173  MemoryAllocator* mPoolAllocator;
174 
175  public:
176 
178  bool isShape1Convex;
179 
185  Map<uint64, LastFrameCollisionInfo*> lastFrameCollisionInfos;
186 
188  ConcaveOverlappingPair(uint64 pairId, int32 broadPhaseId1, int32 broadPhaseId2, Entity collider1, Entity collider2,
189  NarrowPhaseAlgorithmType narrowPhaseAlgorithmType,
190  bool isShape1Convex, MemoryAllocator& poolAllocator, MemoryAllocator& heapAllocator)
191  : OverlappingPair(pairId, broadPhaseId1, broadPhaseId2, collider1, collider2, narrowPhaseAlgorithmType), mPoolAllocator(&poolAllocator),
192  isShape1Convex(isShape1Convex), lastFrameCollisionInfos(heapAllocator, 16) {
193 
194  }
195 
196  // Destroy all the LastFrameCollisionInfo objects
197  void destroyLastFrameCollisionInfos() {
198 
199  for (auto it = lastFrameCollisionInfos.begin(); it != lastFrameCollisionInfos.end(); ++it) {
200 
201  // Call the destructor
202  it->second->LastFrameCollisionInfo::~LastFrameCollisionInfo();
203 
204  // Release memory
205  mPoolAllocator->release(it->second, sizeof(LastFrameCollisionInfo));
206  }
207 
208  lastFrameCollisionInfos.clear();
209  }
210 
211  // Add a new last frame collision info if it does not exist for the given shapes already
212  LastFrameCollisionInfo* addLastFrameInfoIfNecessary(uint32 shapeId1, uint32 shapeId2) {
213 
214  uint32 maxShapeId = shapeId1;
215  uint32 minShapeId = shapeId2;
216  if (shapeId1 < shapeId2) {
217  maxShapeId = shapeId2;
218  minShapeId = shapeId1;
219  }
220 
221  // Try to get the corresponding last frame collision info
222  const uint64 shapesId = pairNumbers(maxShapeId, minShapeId);
223 
224  // If there is no collision info for those two shapes already
225  auto it = lastFrameCollisionInfos.find(shapesId);
226  if (it == lastFrameCollisionInfos.end()) {
227 
228  LastFrameCollisionInfo* lastFrameInfo = new (mPoolAllocator->allocate(sizeof(LastFrameCollisionInfo))) LastFrameCollisionInfo();
229 
230  // Add it into the map of collision infos
231  lastFrameCollisionInfos.add(Pair<uint64, LastFrameCollisionInfo*>(shapesId, lastFrameInfo));
232 
233  return lastFrameInfo;
234  }
235  else {
236 
237  // The existing collision info is not obsolete
238  it->second->isObsolete = false;
239 
240  return it->second;
241  }
242  }
243 
245  void clearObsoleteLastFrameInfos() {
246 
247  // For each last frame collision info
248  for (auto it = lastFrameCollisionInfos.begin(); it != lastFrameCollisionInfos.end(); ) {
249 
250  // If the collision info is obsolete
251  if (it->second->isObsolete) {
252 
253  // Call the destructor
254  it->second->LastFrameCollisionInfo::~LastFrameCollisionInfo();
255 
256  // Release memory
257  mPoolAllocator->release(it->second, sizeof(LastFrameCollisionInfo));
258 
259  it = lastFrameCollisionInfos.remove(it);
260  }
261  else { // If the collision info is not obsolete
262 
263  // Do not delete it but mark it as obsolete
264  it->second->isObsolete = true;
265 
266  ++it;
267  }
268  }
269  }
270  };
271 
272  private:
273 
274  // -------------------- Attributes -------------------- //
275 
277  MemoryAllocator& mPoolAllocator;
278 
280  MemoryAllocator& mHeapAllocator;
281 
283  Array<ConvexOverlappingPair> mConvexPairs;
284 
286  Array<ConcaveOverlappingPair> mConcavePairs;
287 
289  Map<uint64, uint64> mMapConvexPairIdToPairIndex;
290 
292  Map<uint64, uint64> mMapConcavePairIdToPairIndex;
293 
295  ColliderComponents& mColliderComponents;
296 
298  CollisionBodyComponents& mCollisionBodyComponents;
299 
301  RigidBodyComponents& mRigidBodyComponents;
302 
304  Set<bodypair>& mNoCollisionPairs;
305 
307  CollisionDispatch& mCollisionDispatch;
308 
309 #ifdef IS_RP3D_PROFILING_ENABLED
310 
312  Profiler* mProfiler;
313 
314 #endif
315 
316  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
317 
318  // Move a pair from a source to a destination index in the pairs array
319  void movePairToIndex(uint64 srcIndex, uint64 destIndex);
320 
322  void swapPairs(uint64 index1, uint64 index2);
323 
324  public:
325 
326  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
327 
329  OverlappingPairs(MemoryManager& memoryManager, ColliderComponents& colliderComponents,
330  CollisionBodyComponents& collisionBodyComponents,
331  RigidBodyComponents& rigidBodyComponents, Set<bodypair>& noCollisionPairs,
332  CollisionDispatch& collisionDispatch);
333 
335  ~OverlappingPairs();
336 
338  OverlappingPairs(const OverlappingPairs& pair) = delete;
339 
341  OverlappingPairs& operator=(const OverlappingPairs& pair) = delete;
342 
344  uint64 addPair(uint32 collider1Index, uint32 collider2Index, bool isConvexVsConvex);
345 
347  void removePair(uint64 pairId);
348 
350  void removePair(uint64 pairIndex, bool isConvexVsConvex);
351 
353  void clearObsoleteLastFrameCollisionInfos();
354 
356  void updateCollidingInPreviousFrame();
357 
359  static bodypair computeBodiesIndexPair(Entity body1Entity, Entity body2Entity);
360 
362  void setNeedToTestOverlap(uint64 pairId, bool needToTestOverlap);
363 
365  OverlappingPair* getOverlappingPair(uint64 pairId);
366 
367 #ifdef IS_RP3D_PROFILING_ENABLED
368 
370  void setProfiler(Profiler* profiler);
371 
372 #endif
373 
374  // -------------------- Friendship -------------------- //
375 
376  friend class PhysicsWorld;
377  friend class CollisionDetectionSystem;
378 };
379 
380 // Return the pair of bodies index
381 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bodypair OverlappingPairs::computeBodiesIndexPair(Entity body1Entity, Entity body2Entity) {
382 
383  // Construct the pair of body index
384  bodypair indexPair = body1Entity.id < body2Entity.id ?
385  bodypair(body1Entity, body2Entity) :
386  bodypair(body2Entity, body1Entity);
387  assert(indexPair.first != indexPair.second);
388  return indexPair;
389 }
390 
391 // Set if we need to test a given pair for overlap
392 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void OverlappingPairs::setNeedToTestOverlap(uint64 pairId, bool needToTestOverlap) {
393 
394  assert(mMapConvexPairIdToPairIndex.containsKey(pairId) || mMapConcavePairIdToPairIndex.containsKey(pairId));
395 
396  auto it = mMapConvexPairIdToPairIndex.find(pairId);
397  if (it != mMapConvexPairIdToPairIndex.end()) {
398  mConvexPairs[static_cast<uint32>(it->second)].needToTestOverlap = needToTestOverlap;
399  }
400  else {
401  mConcavePairs[static_cast<uint32>(mMapConcavePairIdToPairIndex[pairId])].needToTestOverlap = needToTestOverlap;
402  }
403 }
404 
405 // Return a reference to an overlapping pair
406 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE OverlappingPairs::OverlappingPair* OverlappingPairs::getOverlappingPair(uint64 pairId) {
407 
408  auto it = mMapConvexPairIdToPairIndex.find(pairId);
409  if (it != mMapConvexPairIdToPairIndex.end()) {
410  return &(mConvexPairs[static_cast<uint32>(it->second)]);
411  }
412  it = mMapConcavePairIdToPairIndex.find(pairId);
413  if (it != mMapConcavePairIdToPairIndex.end()) {
414  return &(mConcavePairs[static_cast<uint32>(it->second)]);
415  }
416 
417  return nullptr;
418 }
419 
420 #ifdef IS_RP3D_PROFILING_ENABLED
421 
422 // Set the profiler
423 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void OverlappingPairs::setProfiler(Profiler* profiler) {
424  mProfiler = profiler;
425 }
426 
427 #endif
428 }
429 
430 #endif
